description: A strange dimension accessible through the Rainbow Mist where ships are automatically transported and trapped. It is a ship graveyard filled with wrecked vessels from different eras and their treasures.
geography: A vast space filled with countless shipwrecks floating or grounded, creating a massive graveyard. The dimension appears to be a space loop where anything returns to its starting point.
notableFeatures: Ship graveyard containing vessels from different time periods
Filled with treasure from wrecked ships
Space loop properties - things return to starting point
Time distortion effects - time passes differently than outside world
Inaccessible except through the Rainbow Mist

keyEvents.description: Luffy, Zoro, Usopp, Robin, and Henzo arrive in Ape's Concert for the first time, discovering the massive ship graveyard.
Luffy discovers treasure chests filled with gold and jewels in the wrecked ships.
The Pumpkin Pirates reveal themselves as the guardians of Ape's Concert.

historicalSignificance: A temporal anomaly that has trapped ships and their crews for decades, possibly centuries. The Pumpkin Pirates and Ian were trapped here for fifty years (from the outside world's perspective) after fleeing from Wetton's attack on Ruluka Island.
culturalNotes: The name is likely a pun on the Sargasso Sea - in Japanese, 'Sargasso' sounds similar to 'saru gassō' (monkey/ape concert)
Serves as a prison for those who enter the Rainbow Mist
Known as 'Wrecker's Reef' in the 4Kids English dub
accessRestrictions: Only accessible through the Rainbow Mist when it appears near Ruluka Island. Extremely difficult to escape due to space loop properties.

connectedLocations.description: The Rainbow Mist serves as the only known entrance to Ape's Concert
The Rainbow Mist appears near Ruluka Island, connecting to Ape's Concert

description: A mysterious fog that serves as a gateway to another dimension (Ape's Concert). It appears unpredictably near Ruluka Island and has unique temporal properties.
geography: A colorful, rainbow-hued mist that appears periodically in the ocean near Ruluka Island.
notableFeatures: Gateway to the pocket dimension Ape's Concert
Time distortion - time passes differently inside versus outside
Documented to appear near Ruluka Island in Paradise

keyEvents.description: Robin explains that time flows differently within the Rainbow Mist, which is why the Pumpkin Pirates haven't aged despite fifty years passing.
The Straw Hats learn that the Going Merry has entered the Rainbow Mist.

historicalSignificance: A legendary phenomenon that has trapped ships and people for generations. Henzo spent fifty years researching it to rescue his friends. The mist has been the subject of local legends on Ruluka Island.
culturalNotes: Described as potentially being 'the last paradise on Earth' according to Robin's research
Said to be filled with treasures from all the ships it has consumed
Local superstition treats it as both a blessing (treasure) and a curse (disappearances)
accessRestrictions: Appears unpredictably. Entering is easy but escaping is extremely difficult due to the space-time distortion within.

connectedLocations.description: The Rainbow Mist is the gateway to the Ape's Concert dimension
The Rainbow Mist appears near Ruluka Island

description: An island in Paradise ruled by the corrupt Mayor Wetton, a former pirate who once attacked and burned the island. It is the location where the Rainbow Mist phenomenon appears.
geography: A standard island with a town and port facilities. Features the Rainbow Tower being constructed by Wetton.
notableFeatures: Historical site of Wetton's pirate attack fifty years ago

keyEvents.description: Lake locates Nami, Sanji, and Chopper on Ruluka Island as they search for their crew.
Commander Rapanui shoots a coin at a robot, but Lake mistakes it for Sanji's action, leading to the Straw Hats being accepted.

historicalSignificance: The island was attacked and burned by the pirate Wetton fifty years ago. After the attack, Wetton became mayor and has ruled tyrannically ever since. The Pumpkin Pirates originated from this island.
culturalNotes: Suffers under Wetton's extreme taxation policies
Citizens are taxed for nearly everything, including eating food they've already paid for
Local legends about the Rainbow Mist and missing ships
Home of scientist Henzo who researched the Rainbow Mist for fifty years
accessRestrictions: Standard island access, though Wetton's government controls entry and exit through taxation and regulations.

connectedLocations.description: The Rainbow Mist periodically appears near Ruluka Island
